title: Web Development Basics
description: Test your knowledge of web development fundamentals

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML (Hyper Text Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.question: CSS is used for styling web pages.
questions.explanation: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and layout web pages.

questions.question: What programming language is primarily used for client-side web interactivity?
questions.explanation: JavaScript is the primary language used for adding interactivity to web pages on the client side.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a valid CSS selector?
questions.explanation: @myElement is not a valid CSS selector. Valid selectors include ID selectors (#), class selectors (.), and pseudo-classes (:).

questions.question: HTTP is a secure protocol by default.
questions.explanation: HTTP is not secure by default. HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP that uses encryption.
